intro: Dolichochaete biseriata, commonly known as the two-rowed thread moss, is a species of moss belonging to the family Dicranaceae. It is characterized by its slender, elongated stems and small, delicate leaves that are typically arranged in two rows along the stem. The plant produces spore capsules that are often curved and covered with a thick, waxy cuticle. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, such as forest floors and rocky crevices. Dolichochaete biseriata plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for microorganisms in its native ecosystems.
